title: Question 8
prompt:
Sentence 5: Her performance during that time has been exceptional.

Which revision should be made to the placement of sentence 5?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The words “this,” “that,” “these,” and “those” are demonstratives. They point out which item the sentence is talking about. In the phrase “that time,” the word “that” points out which time the writer means. The word “that” is a pronoun, referring to another word or phrase. In this case, the word “that” refers to “the past three years.”
(1) Amanda Gomez has worked for our firm for the past three years. (2) She started with us as a part-time receptionist and is later promoted to a full-time executive assistant. (3) She is bright, motivated, and a hard worker. (4) I am sorry to say that our firm must let Amanda go due to budgetary cutbacks. (5) Her performance during that time has been exceptional. (6) I highly recommend her.
When the writer says “that time,” she means “the past three years.” Also like other pronouns, it is best if the demonstrative “that” is placed close to what it refers to. That means it should be near sentence 1.


(1) Amanda Gomez has worked for our firm for the past three years. (5) Her performance during that time has been exceptional. (2) She started with us as a part-time receptionist and is later promoted to a full-time executive assistant. (3) She is bright, motivated, and a hard worker. (4) I am sorry to say that our firm must let Amanda go due to budgetary cutbacks. (6) I highly recommend her.
